{"step_by_step_thinking": "Serum sickness syndrome is a type of hypersensitivity reaction that occurs when the immune system reacts to medications or substances in the blood that it perceives as foreign. It is not a transplant immunity, which is a reaction of the immune system to transplanted organs or tissues. It is also not an anaphylactic shock, which is a severe and potentially life-threatening allergic reaction. Systemic arthus reaction is a localized reaction to a specific antigen, but serum sickness is a systemic reaction, affecting the whole body.", "answer_choice": "C"}
